intro: Cuphea disperma, commonly known as the scattered cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 3 feet, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a suitable choice for gardens and landscapes. Its unique flower structure attracts pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds, contributing to its ecological value.
